name: Sharjah Airport International Free Zone (SAIF Zone)

setup.overview: SAIF Zone offers a strategic business location in the heart of Sharjah with excellent connectivity to major ports and airports. Established in 1995, it has grown to host thousands of companies from over 150 countries. The free zone provides a business-friendly environment with 100% foreign ownership, tax exemptions, and comprehensive support services to facilitate smooth business operations.
steps: Submit initial application form with company name suggestions
Select office space or warehouse facility
Submit required documents for company registration
Receive trade license and other registration documents
Apply for staff visas and other permits as needed
requirements: Passport copies of all shareholders and directors
documents: Passport copies with valid visa pages
Power of Attorney (if application is made through a representative)
setup.timeline: The entire process typically takes 3-4 weeks from initial application to license issuance.

process: Choose a legal structure (FZE, FZC, or Branch)
requirements: Minimum share capital requirements vary depending on the license type and legal structure
At least one shareholder and one director (can be the same person)
No prior criminal record for directors and shareholders
Valid passport and visa for UAE residents
documents: Passport copies of shareholders and directors

packages.name: Warehouse Package
packages.price: Starting from AED 35,000 per year (rates vary by size)
features: Multiple visa eligibility based on space size
Easy access to airport and seaports

types.name: Free Zone Establishment (FZE)
types.description: A limited liability entity with a single shareholder. The minimum capital requirement varies by license type. FZE is suitable for individual entrepreneurs or small businesses looking to establish a presence in the UAE with full ownership.

types.name: Free Zone Company (FZC)
types.description: A limited liability entity with multiple shareholders (2-5). The minimum capital requirement varies by license type. FZC is ideal for partnerships or joint ventures that want to maintain full ownership of their UAE operations.

types.name: Branch of Foreign Company
types.description: A branch of an existing foreign company with no separate legal identity. No capital requirement, but requires a corporate guarantee from the parent company. This option allows foreign companies to extend their activities to the UAE without establishing a new legal entity.

FZE: Minimum capital requirement varies by license type
FZC: Minimum capital requirement varies by license type

types.name: Commercial License
types.description: Allows for trading activities, import/export, and distribution of products. This license is suitable for businesses involved in buying and selling goods without significant modification.

types.name: Service License
types.description: Permits the provision of various services. This license is suitable for consultancies, management firms, and other service providers.

types.name: Industrial License
types.description: Allows for manufacturing, processing, and assembly activities. This license is suitable for businesses that transform raw materials into finished products.

Commercial: Proof of relevant experience (for specific activities)
